'''''quessë''''' is a noun meaning "feather" in [[Quenya]].<ref name="Names">{{App|Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>

[[Image:Quesse.gif|left]]''Quessë'' is also the name in Quenya of the fourth letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the fourth letter of the first grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "voiceless stops" and it is the first letter in the fourth series of consonants.  For written Quenya or [[Sindarin]], the fourth series is used for the labialized ''k'' or ''kw''-series, the ''[[Quessetéma]]'', and ''Quessë'' represents '''KW''' (which may be transcribed in English as '''QU''').  In [[Westron]] the fourth series is used for the ''k''-series, the ''[[Calmatéma]]'', and this letter '''K''' or "hard" '''C''''.<ref>{{App|Letters}}</ref>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Cá'''''.<ref>See ''[[Alphabet of Fëanor: Numenian, or Westron, Mode]]''</ref>

==Etymology==
The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] [[KWES]].<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, KWES-</ref>
